body.p: Though not particularly polyphiloprogenitive, I have three daughters, who have in due course presented me with a total of six grandchildren, to say nothing of a scattering of step children as well. For the avoidance of doubt, though, indulge me as I take this opportunity to present them to you in their spring 2022 shapes.

figure.head: Taken on 12 Feb, at their joint birthday party, here are Paddy, born Feb 2009, and Lila, born Jan 2010. They have just blown out the candles on a joint birthday cake.
Taken on 15 May, here are Louis, born June 2011, and Harvey, born Aug 2016, and their dad. They are probably shooting something.

row.cell: Taken on 24 April after his birthday party, here is Leon, born 2019 with his mum. Definitely time for bed.

cell.hi: Taken on 11 March, here is Coco, born July 2020 and her mum, just looking cute.
Also taken on 11 March, here is Daphne, born Aug 2016 , and the pizza she made.

body.p: My three daughters and their respective families are quite seriously geographically dispersed, which means that we have become correspondingly expert in the available public transport routes to Nottingham, Maryland (E15), and Stourton (near Shipston on Stour), respectively. Also cheap accommodation thereabouts, where there is any (full disclosure: there isn't).

There are persistent rumours that they all plan to move to Bristol soon, but it hasn't happened yet. All of which made at least the first part of 2022 quite busy what with birthday parties and sundry occasions on which grand-parenting duties (usually baby sitting) must be undertaken. Here's a brief checklist: January 21-24
We went to Maryland to look after Coco, Daphne, and Al so that Elizabeth could join her sisters for a much-needed sisterly spa weekend. Full instructions were provided and a splendid time was had by all. Feb 12th
Mass excursion to Stourton for a joint celebration of Lila's and Paddy's 12th birthdays: there was cake and chocolate. March 11-16
To Maryland again. Daphne made a pizza, learned how to make bol renvers√©, and lost a tooth; Coco just looked cute.
To Stourton village hall for Leon's 2nd birthday party: there were lots of nibbles and balloons and everyone got quite tired.
There was also a seesaw
July 10th
Belinda and Sarah came and took us out for Lilette's birthday (aka Panos's birthday barbie) 21-22 Oct
We were back in Maryland, baby-sitting again the weekend before the big family outing.
3-6 November
I am always seem to be away for Belinda's birthday, so this year I suggested she move it back a week. We spent a few days in Arnold and Sherwood, doing exciting things like accompany her to the opticians and having lunch of course. There were also sparklers, which Harvey appreciated.
